title: Ben Lomond Gregor MacDonald receives David  Bunny  Williamson Referee Scholarship | Local Roundup – Santa Cruz Sentinel
body_text:
Ben Lomond’s Gregor MacDonald is receiving a prestigious boost to his career as a rugby referee.
MacDonald, a Pacific Collegiate School alum who is majoring in computer science at UCLA, has been selected as the 2025 recipient of the David “Bunny” Williamson Referee Scholarship, which is maintained by the Northern California Rugby Football Union Referee Society (NCRFURS).
The scholarship fund was created in 2017 to recruit, train and coach young referees in honor of Williamson, a national panel referee and referee evaluator.
MacDonald played rugby for Silicon Valley RFC and began officiating a teenager. A member of NCRFURS, MacDonald is a match official for Division I-A college competitions and has worked other assignments across the country, including several years of Rugbytown 7’s in Colorado.
“Being selected for the David Williamson Scholarship provides an opportunity to expand Bunny’s legacy and represent NCRFURS abroad,” said MacDonald, in a release. “I’m honored and excited to follow in the footsteps of the recipients that came before me. The NCRFURS community has given me the chance to meet amazing people and grow as both a referee and person.”
MacDonald plans to study abroad in England this fall, and is already making connections with British referee officials. He is interested in a career involving data science and AI.
High school softball
Cal-Hi Sports All-State: Monte Vista Christian School senior Kayla Fullalove-Silveira was named Cal-Hi Sports All-State Softball Team for a third straight year. She was honored as a Small School First Team Infielder.
Fullalove-Silveira, a senior corner infielder who is committed to play next season at 2025 Central Atlantic Collegiate Conference regular-season champion University of Bridgeport, was also chosen the Pacific Coast Athletic League’s Mission Division’s Offensive Player of the Year in the spring.
She batted .639 (53 for 83) with 27 extra-base hits this season, including 10 home runs, which tied Monterey’s Denae Lee for the highest total in the Central Coast Section, according to statistics published on maxpreps.com. She drew 19 walks and struck out just seven times.
Youth softball
Blast By the Bay: Santa Cruz Crushers 14U team beat Five Cities Screaming Eagles 7-3 in the championship game of the Blast By the Bay tournament, held at Soquel High and Anna Jean Cummins Park on July 11-13.
In the championship, Addie Boles had four hits, two RBI, and scored twice for the Crushers. Etta Duncan ad three hits, two RBI, and scored twice, and Kaitlyn Clark had a hit and two RBI.
Winning pitcher Hailey Leimas gave up eight hits, four runs over six innings with four strikeouts.
The tournament drew 49 travel teams that competed in 8U through 14U age divisions.
Beach volleyball
No Attitudes: Mens: Santa Cruz’s Matty Rayray and Felipe Zacarias took first in the Men’s division at the No Attitudes Beach Volleyball Tournament at Main Beach on Saturday.
Santa Cruz’s Holly Runtell, Raphael Turcios, Emily Hunter and Peter Thach (Four person) also took first.
Other division winners include: San Jose’s Yara Khoury and Sabrina Carley (Women’s), San Jose’s Patri Ventura and Matt Hennes (Coed Intermediate), San Jose’s Greesan Gurumurthy and Tian Yin (Coed Novice), and Union City’s Zurian Xavier and Jhoesell Acosta (Teens).
